summary: A character reference letter addressed to Judge Alison Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell, written by an unnamed friend who lived with Maxwell rent-free for a period. The writer praises Maxwell's moral character, loyalty, and kindness, and asserts belief in her innocence.

persons.name: Alison I. Nathan
persons.context: Addressed as "Your Honor" in the letter; the recipient of this character reference regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the character reference letter. The writer describes her as a loyal and kind friend who provided free housing and asserts belief in her innocence regarding the charges against her.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
The author states they have been a friend of Maxwell for over 25 years and that Maxwell provided them with free housing.

events.title: Character Reference Letter Submission
events.description: An unnamed friend of Ghislaine Maxwell submits a letter to Judge Alison Nathan vouching for Maxwell's character and asserting her innocence.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a character reference letter for Ghislaine Maxwell submitted to the presiding judge in her case.
The author, an unnamed friend, lived with Maxwell rent-free for a period after being offered housing.
The author strongly asserts Maxwell's moral character, specifically her loyalty and kindness.
The author states a belief in Maxwell's innocence regarding the charges against her.
The letter is dated December 1, 2020, during Maxwell's pre-trial proceedings.
